content.title: Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to the Publishers for Publishing Books of Goan Authors
content.department: Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa
content.details: Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to the Publishers for Publishing Books of Goan Authors has been designed to promote Goan publishers to provide them with financial support for the publication of books.
benefits: Upto 300 books will be purchased, subject to the condition that the total amount should not exceed ₹ 50,000/-
The publisher shall give a minimum 15% discount on the price of the book.
eligibility: Any Goan publisher is eligible for the scheme provided the writer of the book is Goan.
The applicant should have substantial experience in publication.
The applicant should publish a minimum of 500 copies of the book for which he wants to avail the financial assistance.
The book could be published by the author himself or published by any other publishing unit provided NOC is issued by the author to the publisher.
The printing and paper of the book should be of good quality & standard.
A person who has lived in Goa for a minimum of 10 years of his creative lifespan will be treated as Goan for the purpose of this scheme.
exclusions: No grants should be given for the printing of the second edition.
Works of translation will not be considered.
No anthology/ compilation shall be considered.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, and follow the specified steps to apply.
documents_required: Noc of the Writer as Per Enclosed Format.
Address Proof of the Writer Such as Residential Certificate/ Photocopy of Election Card/ Aadhar Card/ Ration Card Etc.
Bank Details of the Applicant as Per Enclosed Proforma or Xerox Copy of the Cheque.
Undertaking of the Writer/ Publisher (10 Years Resident) as Per Enclosed Format.

faqs.question: Is there room for relaxation of the scheme's clauses and conditions?
faqs.answer: Yes, the government has the authority to relax any or all of the scheme's clauses if it deems fit, with reasons to be recorded.

faqs.question: What are the guidelines regarding the utilization of grants?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must strictly use the grant for the purpose it is sanctioned, and they should produce a utilization certificate within three months from the date of receiving the grant.

faqs.question: Can you explain the disbursement procedure for this scheme?
faqs.answer: After the committee recommends the grants, the Director of Art & Culture obtains government approval and makes the payment for the purchase of books.

faqs.question: How is the selection process for this scheme conducted?
faqs.answer: The government constitutes a committee for the scheme, which reviews and scrutinizes the applications.

faqs.question: What exclusions apply to this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not provide grants for the printing of the second edition of a book, and works of translation or anthologies/compilations are not considered.

faqs.question: How is the Goan identity of the author determined for this scheme?
faqs.answer: A person who has lived in Goa for a minimum of 10 years of their creative lifespan is considered a Goan for the purpose of this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements for the content of the book?
faqs.answer: Yes, the book should be 100% original, and both the printing and paper quality must be of good standard.

faqs.question: Can books be published by the author themselves, or must they be published by a separate publishing unit?
faqs.answer: The book can be published either by the author or by any other publishing unit, but if it's published by a different unit, the author must issue a No Objection Certificate (NOC) to the publisher.

faqs.question: Has this scheme received approval from the Finance department, and if so, under what reference?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme has been issued with the concurrence of the Finance department under their U.O No. 1169/F dated 04/05/2016.

faqs.question: Who has the final say in interpreting any questions or issues related to the scheme?
faqs.answer: The government has the final decision-making authority for the interpretation of any clause, word, expression, or the entire scheme.
